intro: Epilobium stevenii, commonly known as Steven's willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. The plant features erect, slender stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy, pink to purple flowers appear in clusters at the ends of the stems, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Epilobium stevenii is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other willow herbs and flowering plants with similar morphological characteristics.
